New Records: Dodgers pitchers tied the postseason record of 33 consecutive scoreless innings
Key Match Events: The Dodgers knocked out Kodai Senga in the second inning
Mookie Betts added a three-run double in the eighth
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the first scoreless postseason start of seven-plus innings since Clayton Kershaw's eight innings in the 2020 NL Wild Card Series
Others: Shohei Ohtani was 2 for 4 with a walk while scoring two runs and driving in another
Jack Flaherty allowed two hits over seven innings in the Dodgers' first scoreless postseason start
